questions.questionText: Who was the first President of the United States?
questions.answer: George Washington served as the first President.

questions.questionText: What was the main cause of the World War I?
questions.answer: The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria in June 1914 was the main trigger for World War I, but the war was the result of complex political and military alliances, along with widespread militarism and nationalism.

questions.questionText: In which year did the fall of the Berlin Wall occur?
questions.answer: The Berlin Wall fell on November 9, 1989, marking the beginning of the end of the Cold War and leading towards German reunification.

questions.questionText: Who was known as the 'Maid of Orléans' and led the French army to victory over the English at the Siege of Orléans?
questions.answer: Joan of Arc, also known as the 'Maid of Orléans', led the French army to victory over the English at the Siege of Orléans in 1429.

questions.questionText: What ancient civilization is known for building the Pyramids of Giza?
questions.answer: The ancient Egyptians are known for building the Pyramids of Giza around 2580–2560 BC during the Fourth Dynasty of the Old Kingdom.
